We're committed to free and open source software. Primarily, we use Python/Arduino/C to develop solutions to our experimental and analysis problems. Interested in collaborating? Please, get in touch!

# Released

## HARP
:::: {}

::: {layout="[ 66,33 ]"}
![](./images/harp.png)

Hierarchical Atomic Resolution Perception (HARP) is software for assessing cryoEM model quality.

:::

* Read the preprint: [Scale-dependent hierarchical resolution: applications to atomic resolution and model validation in cryoEM](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.10.17.562748v1)
* Visit the [HARP website](https://bayes-shape-calc.github.io/HARP/)
* See the code on [GitHub](https://github.com/bayes-shape-calc/HARP)

::::



## tMAVEN
:::: {}
::: {layout="[ 50,50 ]"}
![](./images/tmaven_screenshot.png)

time-series Modeling, Analysis, and Visualization ENvironment (tMAVEN) is software for post-processing, modeling, and generating publication quality figures for smFRET data. It was made in collaboration with the [Gonzalez lab](http://www.columbia.edu/cu/chemistry/groups/gonzalez/index.html).
:::

* Read the preprint: [Increasing the accuracy of single-molecule data analysis using tMAVEN](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.08.15.553409v1)
* Visit the [tMAVEN website](https://gonzalezbiophysicslab.github.io/tmaven/)
* See the code on [GitHub](https://github.com/GonzalezBiophysicsLab/tmaven)
::::




## BIASD

:::: {}
::: {layout="[50,100]"}
![](./images/biasd.jpg)

Bayesian Inference for the Analysis of Sub-temporal-resolution Data (BIASD) is a method to temporally resolve the kinetics a single-molecule time series, even if those kintics are orders of magnitude faster than the time resolution of the technique.
:::

* Read the first paper: [Increasing the Time Resolution of Single-Molecule Experiments with Bayesian Inference](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.bpj.2017.11.3741)
* Read the next paper: [Entropic control of the free-energy landscape of an archetypal biomolecular machine](10.1073/pnas.2220591120)
* See the code on [GitHub](https://github.com/ckinzthompson/biasd)

::::

## removecysteines
:::: {}

::: {layout="[ 50,100 ]"}
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ckinzthompson/removecysteines/main/docs/mRuby3_pca_esm2_t33_650M_UR50D.png)

`removecysteines` is software that uses a masked large language model (ESM2) to engineer out cysteine residues from protein sequences.

:::

* See the code on [GitHub](https://github.com/ckinzthompson/removecysteines)
* Run the code on Google Colab. <a href="https://colab.research.google.com/github/ckinzthompson/removecysteines/blob/main/remove_cysteines.ipynb" target="_parent"><img src="https://colab.research.google.com/assets/colab-badge.svg" alt="Open In Colab"/></a>
::::
